eurucamp

28 - 29 May 2011 – Berlin, Germany

What's eurucamp?

Just like you, we noticed a huge amount of interest in EuRuKo this year and a lot of people (including the organisers of eurucamp) weren't able to get tickets.

So we're assembling an alternative programme for those who want to come to Berlin and hear about, talk about and hack about (with) Ruby.

What we're planning to do:

  • A Barcamp-style event consisting of workshops and hack-spaces.
  • Depending on interest, an alternative line up of talks.

As far as possible, we'll coordinate the social events with the EuRuKo organisers, so you'll still have a chance to meet up with those attending.

Contact Us

info at eurucamp.org

Our Wiki

Pre-registration now closed

23 Apr, 2011

Thank you to everyone who expressed their interest in eurucamp. The pre-registration has now closed. We wanted to receive confirmation of interest in the event and gauge numbers for planning. We’ve been pleasantly surprised by the amount of interest in the event, as well as by the fantastic generosity of supporters and sponsors.

If you haven’t yet heard from us, then keep an eye on your email. We’ll be writing to you over the Easter weekend.
